comments:
This error came up while trying to create a new Junit test suite, but from the
stack trace it looks like it's really in SWT. 

What I did:

Select a package, pull down New->Other, select Junit Test Suite.  Accept the
defaults, click Finish.  Message dialog says "Creation of element failed.
Invalid thread access."  

Here's the detailed info from the error log:

What VM are you using?  Eclipse required 1.4.1 or greater.

java -version says:

java version "1.4.2"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2-b28)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.2-b28, mixed mode)

I don't know whether this error was present in 3.0M8 or earlier, as I did not
try to create a JUnit test suite in any of those versions.

This is what I think is happening.  There is an invalid thread access because 
someone is calling getText() from the wrong thread.  This is being caught and 
an event loop is being started up again in the (wrong?) thread.

I think the problem lies in 
org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread

Moving to Platform UI.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 63647 ***
